title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 3.17 - Executive order no. 17: [terminating requirement upon attorney general in relation to certain criminal proceedings pending in new york county.]
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 3.17 - Executive order no. 17: [terminating requirement upon attorney general in relation to certain criminal proceedings pending in new york county.]
State Regulations
WHEREAS, on March 18, 1974, at the request of the District

Attorney of New York County, Richard H. Kuh, the Governor made a requirement
upon you in relation to specified criminal proceedings pending in the County of

New York, in which Mr. Kuh had been involved as defense counsel prior to his
becoming District Attorney, and
WHEREAS, Mr. Kuh is no longer the District Attorney of New

York County, and the need for said requirement upon you no longer exists, and
WHEREAS, Robert M. Morgenthau, the present District

Attorney of New York County, and you, the Attorney General of this State, have
requested that said requirement be terminated and jurisdiction over the
specified criminal proceedings be returned to the District Attorney of New York

County. NOW, THEREFORE, I hereby terminate the requirement upon you
of March 18, 1974, effective this date. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
3.17

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
